introduction.title: Werden - Future Tense & Passive Voice
introduction.description: The verb 'werden' is one of the most important verbs in German. Beyond meaning 'to become', it's essential for forming the future tense (Futur I) and the passive voice.

uses.title: 1. Main Verb: 'to become'
uses.description: Werden as a standalone verb means 'to become' or 'to get'.

uses.title: 2. Future Tense (Futur I)
uses.description: Werden + infinitive creates the future tense, expressing plans, predictions, or intentions.
uses.note: In spoken German, present tense + time expression is often used instead: 'Ich arbeite morgen' (I work tomorrow). Future tense emphasizes the future or shows certainty.

uses.title: 3. Passive Voice (Passiv)
uses.description: Werden + past participle creates the passive voice, shifting focus from who does the action to what is done.
uses.note: The passive voice is very common in German, especially in formal writing and news.

exercises.question: Ich _____ morgen nach Berlin fahren. (Future: I will drive to Berlin tomorrow)
exercises.explanation: Future tense uses 'werden' + infinitive. First person singular (ich) = 'werde'.

exercises.question: Complete: Ich werde morgen nach Berlin _____. (fahren)
exercises.explanation: Future tense: werden + infinitive form at the end. The infinitive is 'fahren'.

exercises.question: Du _____ das Buch lesen. (Future: You will read the book)
Das Haus _____ gebaut. (Passive: The house is being built)
exercises.explanation: Passive voice: werden + past participle. 'Das Haus' (the house) is third person singular, so 'wird'.

exercises.question: Complete passive: Das Haus wird _____. (bauen → to build)
exercises.explanation: Passive voice uses past participle 'gebaut' (built) at the end.

exercises.question: Die Bücher _____ gelesen. (Passive: The books are being read)
exercises.explanation: Passive voice with plural 'die Bücher' uses 'werden'.

exercises.question: Identify the use: 'Ich werde Arzt.'
exercises.explanation: 'Werden' + noun = main verb meaning 'to become'. No infinitive or past participle.

exercises.question: Identify the use: 'Der Brief wird geschrieben.'
exercises.explanation: 'Wird' + past participle 'geschrieben' = passive voice (is being written).

exercises.question: Identify the use: 'Wir werden nach Hause gehen.'
exercises.explanation: 'Werden' + infinitive 'gehen' = future tense (we will go home).

exercises.question: Wir _____ nächste Woche umziehen. (Future: We will move next week)
Das Auto _____ repariert. (Passive: The car is being repaired)
exercises.explanation: Passive voice: 'Das Auto' (the car) is third person singular, so 'wird'.

exercises.question: Choose the correct sentence for 'The letter will be written.'
exercises.explanation: Future passive: werden + past participle + werden. 'Wird geschrieben werden' (will be written).

exercises.question: Translate to German: 'She is getting tired.' (werden + adjective)
exercises.explanation: Main verb use: 'Sie wird müde' (she is getting tired). Adjective after werden.

exercises.question: What's the infinitive that completes this future sentence? 'Ich werde Deutsch _____.'
exercises.explanation: Future tense requires the infinitive form: 'lernen' (to learn).

flashcards.explanation: Example: Ich werde arbeiten (I will work)
Example: Das wird gemacht (That is being done)

flashcards.front: Translate: The house is being built
Translate: We will drive to Berlin
Translate: The books are being read
flashcards.explanation: Passive plural: werden + past participle gelesen
